intro: Lycianthes tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan physalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Tibet. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits enclosed in a thick, papery calyx, resembling a lantern. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with serrated edges. Lycianthes tibetica is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
